intro: Phyllanthus leucocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
